comments.raw_text:
The new Account Creation wizard has a "Manual Config" mode, where the hostname etc. fields are in the wizard. If you are already in that "Manual Config" mode, you get another "Advanced Config" button that gets you straight into the Account Manager (same as in Edit menu). It's there to allow the user to configure some rarer options immediately, e.g. IMAP base directory, Draft folder name, POP3 Check interval and POP3 leave on server, etc.pp.. This button is mainly there to keep these options out of the wizard, to avoid user overload and code duplication.

However, to be able to go to the Account Manager, we have to create the account first, in the backend. We should notify the user about this impliation, or make it reversible.

Proposals:
1) Make a popup, an informational message box that appears after clicking "Advanced Config" button and informs the user that
"The account will be created now with the settings (IMAP/POP3, hostname, username) in the previous fields. In Advanced mode, they will not be verified, and they cannot be changed later. If these were not correct, please Cancel and correct them now. Otherwise, you may create the account now, and then change advanced settings in the following dialog."

2) Make it so that if the user clicks Cancel in the following Account Manager dialog, the account will be deleted (without traces, hopefully) again.

comments.raw_text:
So, the envisioned popup dialog is supposed to offer Ok/Cancel choices on its own, thus giving the user a chance to stay in the account wizard?

 - Click "Cancel" to return to the account wizard and modify settings there
 - Click "Ok" to leave the account wizard and edit further advanced settings

BTW: "they cannot be changed later" is incorrect for many parameters, including host name, user name, and connection settings (you can't switch POP vs. IMAP, that's correct).
